class.name: ExampleSecurityConfigurer
class.comment: Secures resources based on role-based access control. For information have a look at the Security module chapter.

class.name: ProxyConfiguration
class.comment: Make use of this if running behind a proxy, e.g. to connect to OAuth Provider

class.name: SpringSecurityConfiguration
class.comment:
Spring-related security configuration. By default no security is used. But OAuth can be enabled if desired.
  • https://spring.io/guides/tutorials/spring-boot-oauth2/
  • http://www.baeldung.com/rest-api-spring-oauth2-angularjs
  • https://spring.io/guides/gs/securing-web/
  • https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-security/tree/master/samples/boot/oauth2login
  • https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current-SNAPSHOT/reference/htmlsingle/#boot-features-security

class.name: AttributeChange
class.comment: Represents the change of an attribute.

field.name: attribute
field.comment: Name of field undergoing the change.

field.name: newValue
field.comment: New value after changge.

field.name: oldValue
field.comment: Old value before change.

field.name: changeTime
field.comment: Time of change.

class.name: Login
class.comment: Represents user login information of the user.

field.name: id
field.comment: Constant &qout;me&qout;

field.name: userName
field.comment: Name of the logged in user

field.name: votes
field.comment: Votes of the logged in user.

field.name: secrets
field.comment: Login secrets of this user.

class.name: MovieEntity
class.comment:
Represents a movie. This comment also demonstrates some HTML-to-asciidoc conversion within crnk-asciidoc. This is a list:
  • Some
  • List
  • Elements
This is a new
line.

This is a paragraph

This is a link: Google

field.name: votes
field.comment: A link to a non-JPA resource. Served from the other side through the mappedBy-declartion. Must be transient to not get persisted.

class.name: PersonEntity
class.comment: Represents a person involed with a movie through roles.

field.name: name
field.comment: Name of subject, e.g. Hans Mller (some UTF8 testing here...)

class.name: RoleEntity
class.comment: Role within a movie.

field.name: id
field.comment: Unique identifier of the role

field.name: name
field.comment: Name of the role.

field.name: description
field.comment: Description of role.

field.name: movie
field.comment: Move this role is associated to.

field.name: person
field.comment: Person this role is associated to.

class.name: ScheduleEntity
class.comment: Release schedule of a movie.

class.name: Screening
class.comment: Screening of a movie at a particular location.

field.name: movie
field.comment: relationship that is backed by a simple movieId attribute carrying the @JsonApiRelationId annotation.

field.name: location
field.comment: relationship that is backed by the ScreeningLocationRepository. ID of location always included response.

field.name: status
field.comment: Current status of a screening implemented as nested resource.

field.name: time
field.comment: Time of screening.

class.name: ScreeningStatus
class.comment: Status of a screening.

field.name: screeningId
field.comment: Both annotations together bind the status to its screening parent. Since we have a one-to-one relationship, both resources have the same identifier. Implemented by the single attribute carrying both the relationship and id annotation.

class.name: Secret
class.comment: Login secret for the user. Implemented as nested resource of login.

class.name: SecretId
class.comment: Identifier for nested Secret resource.

field.name: id
field.comment: Id of the secret.

field.name: loginId
field.comment: Id of the parent login resource.

class.name: Vote
class.comment: Vote from a user for a movie.

field.name: movie
field.comment: Voted movie.

field.name: user
field.comment: User that published the vote. TODO create seperate "user" and "login"

class.name: AttributeChangeFieldProvider
class.comment:
Warning: rather an advanced use case where resources are modified on-the-fly by adding further fields to it.

In practive one rather explicitly defines a @JsonApiRelation . This is simpler and recommended, but may not always be possible if the resource cannot be change.

FIXME lookup ResourceFieldContributor during crnk boot process

class.name: AttributeChangeRelationshipRepository
class.comment:
Generic repository that introduces a history relationship for project and task resource without touching those resources.

Mock implementation not doing much. Actual history has to be fetched in real-world implementations

class.name: AttributeChangeResourceRepository
class.comment:
See AttributeChangeRelationshipRepository for more information/actual use case

Mock implementation not doing much. Actual history has to be fetched in real-world implementations

interface.name: MovieRepository
interface.comment: Interface to a list of movies with type-safe access to links and meta data. Can be used by Crnk-client or any other internal consumer of the repository.

class.name: LocationRepository
class.comment: Showcases a simple in-memory repository.

class.name: MovieRepository.ScheduleListMeta
class.comment: With the use of {@link HasMoreResourcesMetaInformation} we do not offer a last page link, only first, previous and next. This allows to skip total row count computation with a second, potentially expensive query.

class.name: ScreeningLocationRepository
class.comment: Establishes a custom relationship between screenings and location.

class.name: ScreeningRepository
class.comment: Showcases a simple in-memory repository.

class.name: ScreeningStatusRepository
class.comment: Showcases a simple in-memory repository.

method.name: findAll
method.comment: Retrieve status if ID has been passed in QuerySpec. Does not allow generic findAll without filters (for the time being). Sufficient to retrieve the status for a screening.

class.name: VoteRepository
class.comment:
Showcases a simple in-memory repository with some artificial slow down to simulate expensive requests and show loading indicators in the frontend.

Real-world application may rather make use of the existing {@link InMemoryResourceRepository}.

class.name: ScheduleDecorator
class.comment: The decorator is registered through ScheduleDecoratorFactory. It intercepts all calls to ScheduleRepository and updates the name to upper case.

class.name: ScheduleDecoratorFactory
class.comment: sets up an ScheduleDecorator to intercepts and modifies any request for ScheduleEntity. with a further value. Can be used to intercept and modify requests in an arbitrary fashion.

class.name: LoginRepository
class.comment: Makes logged-in user available as JSON API resource.

class.name: SecretRepository
class.comment: Showcases throwing a forbidden exception.
